translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Have ye taken security from Him Who is in the heaven that He will not cause the earth to swallow you when lo! it is convulsed?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Are you secure that He who is in the sky will not make the earth swallow you while it quakes?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Do you feel secure that He who is in the heaven will not cause the earth to swallow you up while it shakes?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Do you feel secure that He who [holds authority] in the heaven would not cause the earth to swallow you and suddenly it would sway?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do you feel secure that the One in the heavens will not cause you to sink into the earth when it is violently shaking?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Are you secure of those in the heaven that He should not make the earth to swallow you up? Then lo! it shall be in a state of commotion.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Aamintum man fee alssamai an yakhsifa bikumu alarda faitha hiya tamooru

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do you feel secure that He who is in heaven will not cause the earth to sink beneath you and then begin to quake?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Do ye feel secure that He Who is in heaven will not cause you to be swallowed up by the earth when it shakes (as in an earthquake)?

verses.text: أَمْ‌ أَمِنْتُمْ‌ مَنْ‌ فِي‌ السَّمَاءِ أَنْ‌ يُرْسِلَ‌ عَلَيْکُمْ‌ حَاصِباً فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ‌ کَيْفَ‌ نَذِيرِ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا از کسی که حاکمیت و فرمانروایی اش در آسمان قطعی است [چه رسد در زمین] خود را در امان دیده اید از اینکه توفانی سخت [که با خود ریگ و سنگ می آورد] بر شما فرستد؟ پس به زودی خواهید دانست که بیم دادن من چگونه است!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا از آن كه در آسمان است ايمن نشسته‌ايد كه ناگاه بادى همراه با سنگريزه بر سر شما فرستد؟ به زودى خواهيد دانست كه بيم‌دادن من چگونه است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: يا از آن كس كه در آسمان است ايمن شده‌ايد كه بر سر شما تندبادى سنگبار فرو فرستد؟ پس زودا كه بدانيد بيم دادن من چگونه است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: يا از آن كس كه در آسمان است ايمن شده‌ايد كه بر [سر] شما تندبادى از سنگريزه فرو فرستد؟ پس به زودى خواهيد دانست كه بيم دادن من چگونه است

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا از قهر خدای مقتدری که در (زمین و) آسمان حکمفرماست ایمنید که تندبادی بفرستد و بر سر شما سنگ ببارد تا بدانید که وعده عذاب من چگونه است؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: یا این که از کسی که در آسمان است خود را در امان می‌دانید که طوفان شن بر شما گمارد (و شما را در زیر ریگهای روان دفن نماید؟). آن گاه خواهید دانست که تهدید من چگونه است. [[«حَاصِباً»: تند بادی که توده‌های شن و سنگریزه را با خود حرکت می‌دهد و از جائی به جائی می‌برد (نگا: اسراء / 68، عنکبوت / 40). «نَذِیرِ»: بیم دادن من. تهدید من. واژه نذیر در اینجا به معنی تحذیراست.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا از آن که در آسمان است ایمنید که بر شما شن‌بادی بفرستد، زودا که بدانید هشدار من چگونه است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: یا خود را از عذاب خداوند آسمان در امان می‌دانید که تندبادی پر از سنگریزه بر شما فرستد؟! و بزودی خواهید دانست تهدیدهای من چگونه است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا ایمن شدید از آنکه در آسمان است که بفرستد بر شما سنگ ریزه پس زود است بدانید چگونه بوده است ترساننده من‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا از آن كه در آسمان است ايمن شده‌ايد از اينكه بر شما بادى سنگبار فرستد؟ پس بزودى خواهيد دانست كه بيم‌دادن من چگونه است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا از آن کسی که در آسمان است ایمن شدید، که بر شما (تندبادی با) سنگریزه‌ای فرو فرستد؟ پس به زودی خواهید دانست که بیم‌دهنده‌ی (از سوی) من چگونه است!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or have you become so unafraid that He who is in Heaven will not send a violent wind to shower stones at you? Then you will know the import of My commination!

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or have you become unafraid of the One Who controls the heavens, that He will not send a torrent of stones upon you? So now you will realise, how My warning turned out!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Do you feel secure that He who is in heaven will not loose against you a squall of pebbles, then you shall know how My warning is?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Or are ye secure that He Who is in the heaven will not send against you a whirlwind? Anon ye shall know what wise hath been My warning.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or do you feel secure that He, Who is over the heaven (Allah), will not send against you a violent whirlwind? Then you shall know how (terrible) has been My Warning?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or are you confident that the One in Heaven will not unleash against you a violent storm? Then you will know what My warning is like.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Do you feel secure that He Who is in the heaven will not let loose upon you a storm of stones? Then shall you know what My warning is like!

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or do you feel secure that He, Who is over the heaven, will not send against you a Hasib Then you shall know how has been My warning.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or have ye taken security from Him Who is in the heaven that He will not let loose on you a hurricane? But ye shall know the manner of My warning.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Are you secure that He who is in the sky will not unleash upon you a rain of stones? Soon you will know how My warning has been!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Do you feel secure that He who is in the heaven will not loose against you a squall of pebbles then you shall know how was My warning.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or do you feel secure that He who [holds authority] in the heaven would not send against you a storm of stones? Then you would know how [severe] was My warning.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do you feel secure that the One in the heavens will not strike you with a sandstorm? You will soon know, with the coming of the torment, how serious Our warning was.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or are you secure of those in the heaven that He should not send down upon you a punishment? Then shall you know how was My warning.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am amintum man fee alssamai an yursila AAalaykum hasiban fasataAAlamoona kayfa natheeri

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do you feel secure that the One in heaven will not send against you a whirlwind to pelt you with stones, so that you will know how [true] My warning was?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or do ye feel secure that He Who is in Heaven will not send against you a violent tornado (with showers of stones), so that ye shall know how (terrible) was My warning?

verses.text: وَ لَقَدْ کَذَّبَ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ مِنْ‌ قَبْلِهِمْ‌ فَکَيْفَ‌ کَانَ‌ نَکِيرِ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و مسلماً کسانی که پیش از آنان بودند [آیات خدا و پیامبران را انکار کردند]، پس [بنگر] عذاب من چگونه بود!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هر آينه كسانى كه پيش از آنها بودند، پيامبران را تكذيب كردند. پس عذاب من چگونه بود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و البته كسانى هم كه پيش از آنها بودند به تكذيب پرداختند، پس [بنگر] عذاب من چگونه بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و پيش از آنان [نيز] كسانى به تكذيب پرداختند پس عذاب من چگونه بود؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و همانا امم پیش از اینها نیز (رسولان ما را) تکذیب کردند پس (بنگرید) چگونه سخت آنها را هلاک کردم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: کسانی که پیش از اینان بوده‌اند (آیات و پیغمبران مرا) تکذیب کرده‌اند، ببین که خشم و کینه‌ی من بر سر ایشان چه آورده است و چه کرده است؟! [[«نَکیرِ»: بد آمدن من از ایشان. خشم و کینه‌ام. واژه (نکیر) به معنی (انکار) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به راستی که پیشینیان آنان تکذیب پیشه کردند پس [بنگر که‌] عقوبت من چگونه بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: کسانی که پیش از آنان بودند (آیات الهی را) تکذیب کردند، امّا (ببین) مجازات من چگونه بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا تکذیب کردند آنان که پیش از ایشان بودند پس چگونه بود کین کشیدن من‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه كسانى كه پيش از آنان بودند تكذيب كردند، پس انكار [و كيفر] من چگونه بود؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و همانا پیش از آنان (نیز) بی‌گمان کسانی تکذیب کردند. پس انکار (و انگار) من چگونه بود؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Those before them had also denied. And how was My punishment then!

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed those before them had denied – therefore how did My rejection turn out!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Those that were before them also cried lies; then how was My horror!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And assuredly those before them belied; then what wise hath been My wrath!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And indeed those before them belied (the Messengers of Allah), then how terrible was My denial (punishment)?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Those before them also denied the truth; and how was My disapproval?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Those who came before them also gave the lie (to the Messengers): then how awesome was My chastisement!

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And indeed those before them rejected, then how terrible was My reproach

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And verily those before them denied, then (see) the manner of My wrath (with them)!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Certainly those who were before them had impugned [My apostles]; but then how was My rebuttal!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Those who have gone before you also belied (their Messengers) then how was My disapproval!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And already had those before them denied, and how [terrible] was My reproach.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Those who lived before them had also rejected Our warning, and how terrible was Our retribution!

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And certainly those before them rejected (the truth), then how was My disapproval.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walaqad kaththaba allatheena min qablihim fakayfa kana nakeeri

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Those who went before them belied [the truth]: then how great was My rejection of them.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But indeed men before them rejected (My warning): then how (terrible) was My rejection (of them)?

verses.text: أَ وَ لَمْ‌ يَرَوْا إِلَى‌ الطَّيْرِ فَوْقَهُمْ‌ صَافَّاتٍ‌ وَ يَقْبِضْنَ‌ مَا يُمْسِکُهُنَ‌ إِلاَّ الرَّحْمٰنُ‌ إِنَّهُ‌ بِکُلِ‌ شَيْ‌ءٍ بَصِيرٌ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا ندانسته اند که پرندگان بالای سرشان را در حالی که بال می گشایند و می بندند، فقط [خدای] رحمان در فضا نگه می دارد؟ یقیناً او بر همه چیز بیناست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا پرندگانى را كه بال گشوده يا بال فراهم‌كشيده بر فراز سرشان در پروازند، نديده‌اند؟ آنها را جز خداى رحمان كسى در هوا نگاه نتواند داشت. اوست كه به همه چيز بيناست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا به پرندگان بالاى سرشان ننگريسته‌اند كه بال‌هايشان را باز و بسته مى‌كنند؟ آنها را جز [خداى‌] رحمان نگاه نمى‌دارد. مسلما او به هر چيزى بيناست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا در بالاى سرشان به پرندگان ننگريسته‌اند [كه گاه‌] بال مى‌گسترند و [گاه‌] بال مى‌آنند؟ جز خداى رحمان [كسى‌] آنها را نگاه نمى‌دارد، او به هر چيزى بيناست.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا مرغان هوا را نمی‌نگرند که بالای سرشان پر گشوده، گاه بی‌حرکت و گاه با حرکت بال پرواز می‌کنند؟ کسی جز خدای مهربان آنها را (در فضا) نگاه نمی‌دارد، که او به احوال همه موجودات کاملا بیناست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا پرندگانی را نگاه نکرده‌اند که بالای سر آنان (در پروازند و) گاهی بالهای خود را گسترده و گاهی جمع می‌کنند؟! جز خداوند مهربان کسی آنها را (بر فراز آسمان) نگاه نمی‌دارد، چرا که او هر چیزی را می‌بیند (و می‌داند هر آفریده‌ای برای ادامه‌ی زندگی خود نیازمند چیست). [[«صَآفَّاتٍ»: گسترده بالان (نگا: نور / 41). «یَقْبِضْنَ»: بالها را فراهم می‌آورند. بالها را باز و بسته می‌کنند. «مَا یُمْسِکُهُنَّ»: (نگا: نحل / 79).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا به پرندگان بر فراز سرشان ننگریسته‌اند، که بال گشاده‌اند و فرو بندند [آن را]، هیچ کس جز خداوند رحمان آنها را نگه نمی‌دارد، که او به هر چیزی بیناست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا به پرندگانی که بالای سرشان است، و گاه بالهای خود را گسترده و گاه جمع می‌کنند، نگاه نکردند؟! جز خداوند رحمان کسی آنها را بر فراز آسمان نگه نمی‌دارد، چرا که او به هر چیز بیناست!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا ننگریستند مرغان بر فراز ایشان بال‌گشایندگان و بازدارندگان بالهای خویش نگاه نداردشان جز خداوند مهربان همانا او است به همه چیز بینا

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آيا به مرغان بر فراز سرشان ننگريسته‌اند كه بالها گشايند و به هم آرند؟ [تا ببينند كه‌] هيچ كس آنها را [در هوا] جز خداى رحمان نگاه نمى‌دارد همانا او به هر چيزى بيناست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا و بالای سرشان، سوی پرندگان ننگریسته‌اند، حال آنکه صف کشیدگان و نگهبانان (خود)اند (و) جز (خدای) رحمان (کسی) آنها را نگه نمی‌دارد؟ به‌راستی او به هر چیزی بسیار بیناست.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Do they not see the birds above them flying wings spread out or folded? Nothing holds them aloft but God. All things are within His purview.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And did they not see the birds above them, spreading and closing their wings? None except the Most Gracious holds them up; indeed He sees all things.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Have they not regarded the birds above them spreading their wings, and closing them? Naught holds them but the All-merciful. Surely He sees everything.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Behold they not the birds above them, outstretching their wings and they also withdraw them? Naught holdeth them except the Compassionate. Verily He is of everything Beholder.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Do they not see the birds above them, spreading out their wings and folding them in? None upholds them except the Most Beneficent (Allah). Verily, He is the All-Seer of everything.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Have they not seen the birds above them, spreading their wings, and folding them? None holds them except the Compassionate. He is Perceiver of everything.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Have they not seen birds above them spreading and closing their wings, with none holding them except the Merciful One? He oversees everything.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Do they not see the birds above them, spreading out their wings and folding them in None upholds them except the Most Gracious. Verily, He is the All-Seer of everything.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Have they not seen the birds above them spreading out their wings and closing them? Naught upholdeth them save the Beneficent. Lo! He is Seer of all things.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Have they not regarded the birds above them spreading and closing their wings? No one sustains them except the All-beneficent. Indeed, He watches all things.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Do they not observe the birds above them, spreading their wings and folding them? None, except the Merciful holds them. Surely, He sees all things.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Do they not see the birds above them with wings outspread and [sometimes] folded in? None holds them [aloft] except the Most Merciful. Indeed He is, of all things, Seeing.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Did they not see the birds above them, stretching out, and flapping their wings. No one keeps them up in the sky except the Beneficent God. He certainly watches over all things.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Have they not seen the birds above them expanding (their wings) and contracting (them)? What is it that withholds them save the Beneficent Allah? Surely He sees everything.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Awalam yaraw ila alttayri fawqahum saffatin wayaqbidna ma yumsikuhunna illa alrrahmanu innahu bikulli shayin baseerun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do they not see the birds above them spreading and closing their wings? None save the Merciful sustains them. Surely, He observes all things.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Do they not observe the birds above them, spreading their wings and folding them in? None can uphold them except (Allah) Most Gracious: Truly (Allah) Most Gracious: Truly it is He that watches over all things.

verses.text: أَمَّنْ‌ هٰذَا الَّذِي‌ هُوَ جُنْدٌ لَکُمْ‌ يَنْصُرُکُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ دُونِ‌ الرَّحْمٰنِ‌ إِنِ‌ الْکَافِرُونَ‌ إِلاَّ فِي‌ غُرُورٍ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا آن کیست [از] سپاهتان که شما را به هنگام نزول عذاب در برابر خدای رحمان یاری دهد؟ کافران جز دچار فریب [شیطان] نیستند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا آنان كه ياران شمايند توانند در برابر خدا ياريتان كنند؟ كافران در فريبى بيش نيستند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا كيست آن كسى كه او سپاه [و پشتوانه‌] شماست و شما را در برابر [خداى‌] رحمان يارى مى‌كند؟ كافران جز دچار فريب نيستند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: يا آن كسى كه خود براى شما [چون‌] سپاهى است كه ياريتان مى‌كند، جز خداى رحمان كيست؟ كافران جز گرفتار فريب نيستند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا آن کیست که سپاه و مددکار شما باشد و همه‌گونه شما را در برابر خدای مهربان یاری تواند کرد؟ پس کافران جز در غرور و فریبی بیش نیستند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آخر کدام اشخاص و افرادند که لشکر شمایند و جدای از خداوند مهربان به شما کمک می‌کنند و از شما مواظبت می‌نمایند؟! کافران گرفتار غرورند و بس. [[«جُندٌ»: لشکر. سپاه. اسم جمع است و در معنی جمع می‌باشد. ذکر اسم اشاره و موصول و فعل آیه به شکل مفرد، با توجّه به لفظ جند است. «مِن دُونِ الرَّحْمنِ»: سوای خداوند مهربان. در برابر خداوند مهربان. با توجّه به معنی اخیر، مفهوم آیه چنین است: آخر چه کسانی هستند آنان که لشکر شمایند و در برابر خداوند مهربان از شما دفاع و به شما کمک می‌نمایند؟ «إِنْ»: حرف نافیه است. «غُرُورٍ»: گول خوردن. فریب.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا کیست آنکه سپاه شماست که شما را در برابر خدای رحمان یاری دهد؟ کافران جز در [توهم و] فریب خوردگی نیستند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا این کسی که لشکر شماست می‌تواند شما را در برابر خداوند یاری دهد؟ ولی کافران تنها گرفتار فریبند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا آنکه اوست سپاهی برای شما یاریتان کند جز خدای مهربان نیستند کافران مگر در فریب‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا كيست آن كه سپاه شما باشد كه شما را در برابر خداى رحمان يارى كند؟ كافران جز در فريفتگى- فريب‌خورده شيطان- نيستند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا آن‌که برایتان سپاهی است تا از (عذاب) رحمان یاریتان کند؟ کافران جز در (ژرفای) فریب نیستند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: What other army do you have to help you apart from Ar-Rahman? The unbelievers are surely lost in delusion.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or which army do you have that will help you against the Most Gracious? The disbelievers are in nothing except an illusion.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or who is this that shall be a host for you to help you, apart from the All-merciful? The unbelievers are only in delusion.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Who. is he that can be an army Unto you and succour you, beside the Compassionate! The infidelsjb are but in delusion.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Who is he besides the Most Beneficent that can be an army to you to help you? The disbelievers are in nothing but delusion.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or who is this who is a force for you to protect you against the Compassionate? The disbelievers are in nothing but delusion.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Which is your army that will come to your aid against the Merciful Lord? But the unbelievers are in utter delusion.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Who is it besides the Most Gracious that can be an army to you to help you The disbelievers are in nothing but delusion.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or who is he that will be an army unto you to help you instead of the Beneficent? The disbelievers are in naught but illusion.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Who is it that is your host who may help you, besides the All-beneficent? The faithless only dwell in delusion.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, who is it that shall be your host to help you, other than the Merciful? Indeed, the unbelievers are only deluded.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or who is it that could be an army for you to aid you other than the Most Merciful? The disbelievers are not but in delusion.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do you have any armies who will help you against the Beneficent God? The disbelievers are certainly deceived (by satan).

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or who is it that will be a host for you to assist you besides the Beneficent Allah? The unbelievers are only in deception.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Amman hatha allathee huwa jundun lakum yansurukum min dooni alrrahmani ini alkafiroona illa fee ghuroorin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Who is there to defend you like an army, besides the Lord of Mercy? Those who deny the truth are in deception.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Nay, who is there that can help you, (even as) an army, besides (Allah) Most Merciful? In nothing but delusion are the Unbelievers.

verses.text: أَمَّنْ‌ هٰذَا الَّذِي‌ يَرْزُقُکُمْ‌ إِنْ‌ أَمْسَکَ‌ رِزْقَهُ‌ بَلْ‌ لَجُّوا فِي‌ عُتُوٍّ وَ نُفُورٍ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یا کیست آنکه به شما روزی دهد، اگر خدا روزی اش را از شما باز دارد؟ [نه اینکه حقیقت را نمی دانند] بلکه در سرکشی و نفرتِ [از حق سرسختی و] پافشاری می کنند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا كيست آن كه به شما روزى دهد اگر او روزى خويش باز دارد؟ نه، در سركشى و دورى از حق لجاج مى‌ورزند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا كيست آن كه اگر [خدا] روزى خود را از شما باز دارد روزيتان مى‌دهد؟ [ولى آنها پند نمى‌گيرند،] بلكه در سركشى و فرار از حق اصرار مى‌ورزند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: يا كيست آن كه به شما روزى دهد اگر [خدا] روزى خود را [از شما] باز دارد؟ [نه‌] بلكه در سركشى و نفرت پافشارى كردند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا آن کیست که اگر خدا از شما رزق خود باز گیرد او روزی به شما تواند داد؟ بلکه کافران دانسته در طغیان و عصیان لجاج ورزند و از حق اعراض می‌کنند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: یا این که چه کسانیند که اگر خداوند روزی خود را باز دارد بتوانند به شما روزی برسانند؟! اصلاً کافران در سرکشی و گریز پافشاری می‌کنند. [[«عُتُوّ»: سرکشی، طغیان. تکبّر. «نُفُورٍ»: گریز، فرار از حق و حقیقت.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا کیست آنکه اگر [خداوند] روزی‌اش را باز گیرد، شما را روزی دهد؟، حق این است که در گردنکشی و رمیدگی پای می‌فشرند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: یا آن کسی که شما را روزی می‌دهد، اگر روزیش را بازدارد (چه کسی می‌تواند نیاز شما را تأمین کند)؟! ولی آنها در سرکشی و فرار از حقیقت لجاجت می‌ورزند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا آنکه او روزیتان همی‌دهد اگر باز دارد روزی خویش را بلکه خیره‌گی کردند در سرکشی و رمیدنی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا كيست آن كه شما را روزى دهد، اگر او روزى خويش بازگيرد؟ بلكه اينان در سركشى و رميدن [خويش‌] فرورفته‌اند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا کیست آن کس که شما را روزی می‌دهد، اگر (خدا) روزی خود را (از شما) باز دارد؟ (نه!) بلکه در سرکشی و نفرت‌، لجاجت و پافشاری کردند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Who is there to give you food in case He withholds His bounty? Yet they persist in rebellion and aversion.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or who is such that will give you sustenance if Allah stops His sustenance? In fact they persist in rebellion and hatred.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or who is this that shall provide for you if He withholds His provision? No, but they persist in disdain and aversion.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Who is he that can provide for you, should He withhold His provision? Aye! they persists in perverseness and aversion.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Who is he that can provide for you if He should withhold His provision? Nay, but they continue to be in pride, and (they) flee (from the truth).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or who is this that will provide for you, if He withholds His provision? Yet they persist in defiance and aversion.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Who shall provide for you if He withholds His sustenance? Nay; but they persist in rebellion and aversion.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Who is it that can provide for you if He should withhold His provision Nay, but they continue to be in pride, and flee.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or who is he that will provide for you if He should withhold His providence? Nay, but they are set in pride and frowardness.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Who is it that may provide for you if He withholds His provision? Indeed, they persist in defiance and aversion.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, who is it that shall provide for you if He withholds His provision? Yet they persist in arrogance and aversion.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or who is it that could provide for you if He withheld His provision? But they have persisted in insolence and aversion.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Is there anyone who will provide you with sustenance if God were to deny you sustenance? In fact, they obstinately persist in their transgression and hatred.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or who is it that will give you sustenance if He should withhold His sustenance? Nay! they persist in disdain and aversion.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Amman hatha allathee yarzuqukum in amsaka rizqahu bal lajjoo fee AAutuwwin wanufoorin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Who can provide for you, if He withholds His provision? Yet they obstinately persist in rebellion and avoidance of the truth.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or who is there that can provide you with Sustenance if He were to withhold His provision? Nay, they obstinately persist in insolent impiety and flight (from the Truth).

verses.text: أَ فَمَنْ‌ يَمْشِي‌ مُکِبّاً عَلَى‌ وَجْهِهِ‌ أَهْدَى‌ أَمَّنْ‌ يَمْشِي‌ سَوِيّاً عَلَى‌ صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا کسی که نگونسار و به صورت افتاده حرکت می کند، هدایت یافته تر است یا آنکه راست قامت بر راه راست می رود؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا آن كس كه نگونسار بر روى افتاده راه مى‌رود، هدايت يافته‌تر است يا آن كه بر پاى ايستاده و بر راه راست مى‌رود؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس آيا آن كه نگونسار بر صورت خويش مى‌رود هدايت يافته‌تر است يا آن كسى كه راست قامت بر راه راست مى‌رود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس آيا آن كس كه نگونسار راه مى‌پيمايد هدايت يافته تر است يا آن كس كه ايستاده بر راه راست مى‌رود؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا آن کس که (در کفر و جهالت) سرنگون به رو در افتاده یا آن که با قامت راست به راه راست (ایمان) است کدام بهتر هدایت یافته‌اند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا آن کسی که نگونسار و بر رخساره راه می‌رود راهیاب‌تر است، یا کسی که بر پا ایستاده و درست در راه راست گام بر می‌دارد؟ [[«مُکِبّاً»: نگونسار، بر رو افتاده. «سَوِیّاً»: راست قامت، راست و درست.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا کسی که به رو در افتاده نگونسار می‌رود، رهیافته‌تر است، یا کسی که استوار بر راه راست ره می‌سپارد؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا کسی که به رو افتاده حرکت می‌کند به هدایت نزدیکتر است یا کسی که راست‌قامت در صراط مستقیم گام برمی‌دارد؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا آنکه روان است افتاد به روی خویش رهنمون تر است یا آنکه می‌رود استوار بر راهی راست‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا كسى كه نگونسار بر روى خود مى‌رود راه‌يافته‌تر است يا آن كه راست ايستاده بر راه راست مى‌رود؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا پس آن کس که نگونسار بر چهره‌اش راه می‌پیماید راه‌یافته‌تر است، یا آن کس که (راستا) بر راهی بس راست می‌رود؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Will he find the way who grovels flat on his face, or he who walks straight on the right path?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So is one who walks inverted upon his face more rightly guided, or one who walks upright on the Straight Path?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What, is he who walks prone upon his face better guided than he who walks upright on a straight path?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Is he, then, who goeth about grovelling upon his face better directed, or he who walketh evenly on a straight path?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Is he who walks without seeing on his face, more rightly guided, or he who (sees and) walks on a Straight Way (i.e. Islamic Monotheism).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Is he who walks bent on his own design better guided, or he who walks upright on a straight path?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Who is better guided: he who walks grovelling on his face, or he who walks upright on a Straight Path?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Is he who walks prone on his face, more rightly guided, or he who walks upright on a straight path

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Is he who goeth groping on his face more rightly guided, or he who walketh upright on a straight road?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Is he who walks prone on his face better guided, or he who walks upright on a straight path?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: What, is he who walks, falling upon his face, more guided than he who walks upright on a Straight Path!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then is one who walks fallen on his face better guided or one who walks erect on a straight path?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Can one who walks with his head hanging down be better guided that one who walks with his head upright?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: What! is he who goes prone upon his face better guided or he who walks upright upon a straight path?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Afaman yamshee mukibban AAala wajhihi ahda amman yamshee sawiyyan AAala siratin mustaqeemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Is he who walks grovelling upon his face better guided, or he who walks upright upon a straight path?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Is then one who walks headlong, with his face grovelling, better guided,- or one who walks evenly on a Straight Way?

verses.text: قُلْ‌ هُوَ الَّذِي‌ أَنْشَأَکُمْ‌ وَ جَعَلَ‌ لَکُمُ‌ السَّمْعَ‌ وَ الْأَبْصَارَ وَ الْأَفْئِدَةَ قَلِيلاً مَا تَشْکُرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: اوست که شما را آفرید و برای شما گوش و دیده و دل قرار داد، ولی اندکی سپاس می گزارید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: اوست كه شما را آفريده است و گوش و چشم و دل داده است. چه اندك سپاس مى‌گزاريد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: اوست آن كس كه شما را آفريد و براى شما شنوايى و ديدگان و دل‌ها پديد آورد. [ولى‌] كم سپاس مى‌گزاريد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «اوست آن كس كه شما را پديد آورده و براى شما گوش و ديدگان و دلها آفريده است. چه كم سپاسگزاريد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو: اوست خدایی که شما را از نیستی به هستی آورد و دو گوش و چشم (شنوا و بینا) و دل (هوشیار) به شما عطا کرد (تا شکر نعمتش گویید) حال آنکه بسیار کم از نعم او شکرگزاری می‌کنید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: خدا کسی است که شما را (از عدم) آفریده است، و برای شما گوش و چشم و دل درست کرده است (که وسیله‌ی کار و سعادت شما هستند. امّا شما این نعمتها را) کمتر سپاسگزاری می‌کنید. [[«قَلِیلاً مَّا تَشْکُرُونَ»: (نگا: اعراف / 10، مؤمنون / 78، سجده / 9).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو او کسی است که شما را پدید آورده است و برای شما گوش [ها] و چشم [ها] و قلب [ها] آفریده است، چه اندکمایه سپاس می‌گزارید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «او کسی است که شما را آفرید و برای شما گوش و چشم و قلب قرار داد؛ امّا کمتر سپاسگزاری می‌کنید!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو او است آنکه پدید آورد شما را و نهاد برای شما گوش و دیدگان و دلها را به کمی سپاس گزارید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: اوست كه شما را آفريد و براى شما گوش و ديدگان و دلها پديد آورد. [ولى‌] اندك سپاس مى‌گزاريد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «اوست آن کسی که شما را پدید آورد، و برای شما گوش‌ها و دیده‌ها و دل‌هایی فروزان آفرید. چه کم سپاسگزارید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Say: "It is He who raised you and gave you ears and eyes and hearts. How little are the thanks you offer!"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Proclaim (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), “It is He Who created you, and made ears and eyes and hearts for you; very little thanks do you offer!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'It is He who produced you, and appointed for you hearing and sight and hearts; little thanks you show!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: He it is who hath brought you forth and hath endowed you with hearing and sights and hearts. Little thanks it is ye give!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say it is He Who has created you, and endowed you with hearing (ears), seeing (eyes), and hearts. Little thanks you give.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “It is He who produced you; and made for you the hearing, and the vision, and the organs. But rarely do you give thanks.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Say: “He it is Who has brought you into being, and has given you hearing and sight, and has given you hearts to think and understand. How seldom do you give thanks!”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "It is He Who has created you, and endowed you with hearing and seeing, and hearts. Little thanks you give."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): He it is who gave you being, and hath assigned unto you ears and eyes and hearts. Small thanks give ye!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘It is He who created you, and made for you hearing, eyesight, and hearts. Little do you thank.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'It is He who has created you and given to you hearing, sight and hearts but little is it that you thank'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, "It is He who has produced you and made for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), say, "It is God who has brought you into being and made ears, eyes, and hearts for you, but you give very little thanks".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: He it is Who brought you into being and made for you the ears and the eyes and the hearts: little is it that you give thanks.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul huwa allathee anshaakum wajaAAala lakumu alssamAAa waalabsara waalafidata qaleelan ma tashkuroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Say, "It is He who brought you into being, and made ears and eyes and hearts for you, yet you are seldom grateful."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say: "It is He Who has created you (and made you grow), and made for you the faculties of hearing, seeing, feeling and understanding: little thanks it is ye give.

verses.text: قُلْ‌ هُوَ الَّذِي‌ ذَرَأَکُمْ‌ فِي‌ الْأَرْضِ‌ وَ إِلَيْهِ‌ تُحْشَرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: اوست که شما را در زمین آفرید و به سوی او محشور می شوید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: اوست كه شما را در زمين آفريد و در قيامت نزد او گرد آورده مى‌شويد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: اوست كه شما را در زمين پراكنده ساخته و به سوى او محشور مى‌شويد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «اوست كه شما را در زمين پراكنده كرده، و به نزد او [ست كه‌] گرد آورده خواهيد شد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو: اوست خدایی که شما را در زمین (از خاک) برانگیخت و (پس از مرگ) باز به سوی او محشور می‌شوید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگو: او کسی است که شما را در زمین تولید و تکثیر کرده و پخش و پراکنده نموده است، و در پیش او گرد آورده می‌شوید. [[«ذَرَأَکُمْ»: شما را پدیدار کرده است. مراد زاد و ولد دادن و افزایش بخشیدن و در زمین پراکندن است (نگا: اعراف / 179).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو او کسی است که شما را در زمین پدید آورد، و به نزد او محشور می‌شوید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «او کسی است که شما را در زمین آفرید و به سوی او محشور می‌شوید!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو او است آنکه آفرید شما را در زمین و بسویش بازگردانیده شوید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: اوست كه شما را در زمين بيافريد و به سوى او برانگيخته و فراهم مى‌شويد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «اوست آن کس که شما را در زمین پدیدار (و) آشکار کرد و تنها فراسوی او(ست که) گرد آورده خواهید شد.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Say: "It is He who dispersed you all over the earth, and to Him you will be gathered."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Say, “It is He Who has spread you out in the earth, and towards Him you will be raised.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'It is He who scattered you in the earth, and unto Him you shall be mustered.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: He it is Who hath spread you over the earth, and Unto Him ye shall be gathered.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say: "It is He Who has created you from the earth, and to Him shall you be gathered (in the Hereafter)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “It is He who scattered you on earth, and to Him you will be rounded up.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Say: “Allah it is Who multiplied you in the earth and to Him you will be mustered.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "It is He Who has created you on the earth, and to Him shall you be gathered."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say: He it is Who multiplieth you in the earth, and unto Whom ye will be gathered.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘It is He who created you on the earth, and toward Him you will be mustered.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'It was He who created you, dispersing you in the earth, and to Him you shall be gathered'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, "It is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Say, "It is God who has settled you on the earth and to Him you will be resurrected".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: He it is Who multiplied you in the earth and to Him you shall be gathered.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul huwa allathee tharaakum fee alardi wailayhi tuhsharoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Say, "It is He who has scattered you on the earth; and it is to Him that you shall all be gathered [on the Day of Resurrection].

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say: "It is He Who has multiplied you through the earth, and to Him shall ye be gathered together."

verses.text: وَ يَقُولُونَ‌ مَتَى‌ هٰذَا الْوَعْدُ إِنْ‌ کُنْتُمْ‌ صَادِقِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و می گویند: اگر راستگویید این وعده وقوع [رستاخیز] کی خواهد بود؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مى‌گويند: اگر راست مى‌گوييد، اين وعده چه وقت فرا مى‌رسد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و مى‌گويند: اين وعده كى خواهد بود اگر راست مى‌گوييد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و مى‌گويند: «اگر راست مى‌گوييد، اين وعده كى خواهد بود؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و کافران (به تمسخر) گویند: این وعده قیامت کی خواهد بود اگر شما راست می‌گویید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: می‌گویند: اگر راست می‌گوئید، این وعده‌ای که می‌دهید، کی خواهد بود؟ [[«الْوَعْدُ»: مراد فرا رسیدن عذاب استیصال دنیوی، و یا فرا رسیدن رستاخیز و عذاب شدید اخروی است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و می‌گویند اگر راست می‌گویید، پس کی این وعده فرا می‌رسد؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها می‌گویند: «اگر راست می‌گویید این وعده قیامت چه زمانی است؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گویند کی است این وعده اگر هستید راستگویان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و مى‌گويند: اين وعده كى خواهد بود، اگر راستگوييد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و می‌گویند: «اگر (از) راستان بوده‌اید، (تحقق) این وعده کی خواهد بود؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But they say: "When will this promise come to pass, if what you say is true?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And they say, “When will this promise come, if you are truthful?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They say, 'When shall this promise come to pass, if you speak truly?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they say: when will this promise be fulfilled, if ye say sooth?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They say: "When will this promise (i.e. the Day of Resurrection) come to pass? if you are telling the truth."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And they say, “When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are truthful?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They say: “If you are truthful, tell us when will this promise (of the Hereafter) be fulfilled?”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They say: "When will this promise come to pass, if you are telling the truth"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And they say: When (will) this promise (be fulfilled), if ye are truthful?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They say, ‘When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are truthful?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They ask: 'When will this promise come, if you speak truthfully'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They say, "When will this torment take place if what you say is true?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And they say: When shall this threat be (executed) if you are truthful?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wayaqooloona mata hatha alwaAAdu in kuntum sadiqeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They ask, "When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are truthful?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They ask: When will this promise be (fulfilled)? - If ye are telling the truth.

verses.text: قُلْ‌ إِنَّمَا الْعِلْمُ‌ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ‌ وَ إِنَّمَا أَنَا نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: دانش و آگاهی [این حقیقت] فقط نزد خداست و من تنها بیم دهنده ای آشکارم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: علم آن نزد خداست و من بيم‌دهنده‌اى آشكارم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: علم آن فقط نزد خداست و من صرفا هشداردهنده‌اى آشكارم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «علم [آن‌] فقط پيش خداست و من صرفاً هشدار دهنده‌اى آشكارم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو: علم آن تنها نزد خداست و من منحصرا وظیفه‌ام این است که شما را (از عذاب حق) بترسانم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگو: اطّلاع و آگاهی (از فرا رسیدن مجازات دنیوی و یا وقوع قیامت) متعلّق به خدا است و بس. من فقط و فقط بیم دهنده‌ی آشکاری هستم. [[«نَذِیرٌ مُّبِینٌ»: بیم دهنده‌ای که آشکارا بیم می‌دهد و به صراحت از عذاب خدا سخن می‌گوید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو آگاهی از آن فقط نزد خداوند است، و من فقط هشداردهنده‌ای آشکارم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «علم آن تنها نزد خداست؛ و من فقط بیم‌دهنده آشکاری هستم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو جز این نیست که علم نزد خدا است و جز این نیست که منم ترساننده آشکار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: همانا دانش [آن‌] نزد خداست و من بيم‌كننده‌اى آشكارم و بس.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «(تمامی) علم تنها نزد خداست و من تنها هشداردهنده‌ای روشنگرم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Say: "God alone has knowledge. My duty is only to warn you clearly."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Proclaim, “Surely Allah has its knowledge; and I am only a Herald of plain warning.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'The knowledge is with God; I am only a clear warner.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: the knowledge is only with Allah, and but a warner manifest.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW): "The knowledge (of its exact time) is with Allah only, and I am only a plain warner."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “Knowledge is with God, and I am only a clear warner.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Say: “Allah alone knows about that; and I am no more than a plain warner.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "The knowledge is with Allah only, and I am only a plain warner."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say: The knowledge is with Allah only, and I am but a plain warner;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘Its knowledge is only with Allah; I am only a manifest warner.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'The knowledge (of that) is with Allah; I am only a clear warner'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, "The knowledge is only with Allah, and I am only a clear warner."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Say, "God knows best. I am only one who gives warning".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: The knowledge (thereof is only with Allah and I am only a plain warner.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul innama alAAilmu AAinda Allahi wainnama ana natheerun mubeenun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Say, "God alone has knowledge of that; and I am only a plain warner."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say: "As to the knowledge of the time, it is with Allah alone: I am (sent) only to warn plainly in public."

verses.text: فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهُ‌ زُلْفَةً سِيئَتْ‌ وُجُوهُ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ کَفَرُوا وَ قِيلَ‌ هٰذَا الَّذِي‌ کُنْتُمْ‌ بِهِ‌ تَدَّعُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس زمانی که آن [وعده داده شده] را از نزدیک ببینند، چهره کافران درهم و زشت گردد [و به آنان گویند:] این است همان چیزی که آن را [از روی مسخره] می خواستید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كافران چون نزديكش بنگرند، چهره‌شان گرفته شود. و به آنها گفته مى‌شود: اين است آنچه باطلش مى‌خوانديد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و چون آن [لحظه موعود] را نزديك ببينند، چهره‌هاى كسانى كه كافر شده‌اند درهم رود و گفته شود: اين همان چيزى است كه طلب مى‌كرديد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و آنگاه كه آن [لحظه موعود] را نزديك ببينند، چهره‌هاى كسانى كه كافر شده‌اند در هم رود، و گفته شود: «اين است همان چيزى كه آن را فرا مى‌خوانديد»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که چون کافران آن عذاب سخت را نزدیک خود به چشم مشاهده کنند رخسار آنها (از خوف) زشت و سیاه شود و به آنها گویند: این همان عذابی است که جدّا درخواست می‌کردید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هنگامی که این وعده‌ی الهی را از نزدیک مشاهده کردند، چهره‌های کافران درهم و زشت می‌گردد، و بدیشان گفته می‌شود: این همان چیزی است که خود می‌خواستید (و در فرا رسیدن و دیدن آن شتاب می‌ورزیدید). [[«زُلْفَةً»: نزدیک. قریب. مصدر است و مراد اسم فاعل. «سِیئَتْ»: (نگا: هود / 77، عنکبوت / 23). «تَدَّعُونَ»: با زور و از روی استهزاء درخواست وقوع فوری آن را داشتید (نگا: ص / 16، شوری / 18).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چون آن را نزدیک بینند، چهره‌های کافران اندوهگین شود، و [به آنان‌] گفته شود، این همان است که [در دنیا از ما به شتاب‌] می‌طلبیدید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هنگامی که آن (وعده الهی) را از نزدیک می‌بینند، صورت کافران زشت و سیاه می‌گردد، و به آنها گفته می‌شود: «این همان چیزی است که تقاضای آن را داشتید»!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: تا هنگامی که دیدندش جایگزین (یا نزدیک) دژم گشت چهره‌های آنان که کفر ورزیدند و گفته شد این است آنچه بودیدش به سختی می‌خواستید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس چون آن [وعده‌] را نزديك‌شده بينند، روى آنان كه كافر شدند بد- زشت و تاريك و ناخوش- گردد و گفته شود: اين است آنچه مى‌خواستيد- مى طلبيديد-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس آن‌گاه که آن (لحظه‌ی موعود) را نزدیک دیدند، چهره‌های آنانی که کافر شدند، بسی به نابسامانی در هم رفت و گفته شد: «این همان چیزی است که آن را فرا می‌خوانده‌اید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When they realise it has come upon them, distraught will be the faces of unbelievers. They will be told: "This is what you asked for."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So when they will see it close, the faces of the disbelievers will become ghastly, and it will be declared, “This is what you were demanding.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then, when they see it nigh at hand, the faces of the unbelievers will be vexed, and it will be said, 'This is what you were promised.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: But when they will behold it proximating sad will be the countenances of those who disbelieve, and it will be said: this is that which ye have been calling for.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But when they will see it (the torment on the Day of Resurrection) approaching, the faces of those who disbelieve will be different (black, sad, and in grieve), and it will be said (to them): "This is (the promise) which you were calling for!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But when they see it approaching, the faces of those who disbelieved will turn gloomy, and it will be said, “This is what you used to call for.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: When they will see it near at hand, the faces of all those who had denied it will be distraught, and then they will be told: “This is the doom which you used to ask for.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But when they will see it approaching, the faces of those who disbelieve will be sad and grievous, and it will be said: "This is what you were calling for!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But when they see it nigh, the faces of those who disbelieve will be awry, and it will be said (unto them): This is that for which ye used to call.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: When they see it brought near, the countenances of the faithless will be contorted, and [they will be] told, ‘This is what you were asking for!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Then, when they see it drawing near, the faces of the unbelievers will be blackened, and it is said: 'This is what you were promised'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But when they see it approaching, the faces of those who disbelieve will be distressed, and it will be said, "This is that for which you used to call."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When they see the torment approaching, the faces of the disbelievers will blacken and they will be told, "This is what you wanted to (experience)".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But when they shall see it nigh, the faces of those who disbelieve shall be sorry, and it shall be said; This is that which you used to call for.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Falamma raawhu zulfatan seeat wujoohu allatheena kafaroo waqeela hatha allathee kuntum bihi taddaAAoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But when they see it drawing near, the faces of those who deny the truth will turn gloomy and they will be told, "This is what you were calling for."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: At length, when they see it close at hand, grieved will be the faces of the Unbelievers, and it will be said (to them): "This is (the promise fulfilled), which ye were calling for!"

verses.text: قُلْ‌ أَ رَأَيْتُمْ‌ إِنْ‌ أَهْلَکَنِيَ‌ اللَّهُ‌ وَ مَنْ‌ مَعِيَ‌ أَوْ رَحِمَنَا فَمَنْ‌ يُجِيرُ الْکَافِرِينَ‌ مِنْ‌ عَذَابٍ‌ أَلِيمٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: به من خبر دهید اگر خدا من را و هر که را با من است هلاک کند، یا مورد رحمت قرار دهد، پس چه کسی کافران را از عذاب دردناک پناه خواهد داد؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: گيرم كه خدا مرا و همراهانم را هلاك كند يا بر ما رحمت آورد، چه كسى كافران را از عذاب دردآور مى‌رهاند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: به من خبر دهيد، اگر خدا مرا و هر كه را با من است هلاك كند يا ما را مورد رحمت قرار دهد، چه كسى كافران را از عذابى دردناك پناه مى‌دهد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «به من خبر دهيد، اگر خدا مرا و هر كه را با من است هلاك كند يا ما را مورد رحمت قرار دهد، چه كسى كافران را از عذابى پر درد پناه خواهد داد؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو: چه تصور می‌کنید؟ اگر خدا من و مؤمنانی که با منند همه را هلاک کند یا لطف و رحمت فرماید آیا آنان که کافرند چه کسی از عذاب دردناک (دوزخ) نجاتشان خواهد داد؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگو به من خبردهید اگر خداوند مرا و تمام کسانی را که با من هستند (و ایمان آورده‌اند) هلاک سازد، و یا به ما رحم نماید (و ما را فعلاً نکشد، به هر حال ما چه حال بمیریم و چه در آینده، اهل نجات هستیم). امّا چه کسی کافران را از عذاب دردناک (دوزخ می‌رهاند و) در پناه خود می‌دارد؟ [[«أَرَأَیْتُمْ»: (نگا: انعام / 46، یونس / 50 و 59، هود / 28). «إِنْ أَهْلَکَنِی»: جواب (إنْ) جمله «فَمَن یَأْتِیکُم بِمَآءٍ مَّعِینٍ» است. «یُجِیرُ»: پناه می‌دهد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو ملاحظه کنید، اگر خداوند مرا و همراهانم را نابود کند، یا بر ما رحمت آورد، پس کیست که کافران را از عذابی دردناک پناه دهد؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «به من خبر دهید اگر خداوند مرا و تمام کسانی را که با من هستند هلاک کند، یا مورد ترحّم قرار دهد، چه کسی کافران را از عذاب دردناک پناه می‌دهد؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو آیا دیدید اگر نابود سازدم خدا و آنکو با من است یا رحم کند بر ما که پناه دهد کافران را از عذابی دردناک‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: مرا گوييد كه اگر خداى مرا و كسانى را كه با من‌اند هلاك كند يا بر ما مِهر و بخشايش آرد، چه كسى [شما] كافران را از عذاب دردناك پناه مى دهد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «آیا دیدید، اگر خدا مرا و هر که را با من است هلاک کند، یا ما را مورد رحمت قرار دهد، پس چه کسی کافران را از عذابی پردرد (فراسوی خود) پناه خواهد داد؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Say: "Just think: If God destroys me and those with me, or is benevolent to us, who will then protect the unbelievers from a painful doom?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Say (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), “What is your opinion –Allah may either destroy me and those with me, or have mercy on us – so who is such that will protect the disbelievers from the painful punishment?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'What think you? If God destroys me and those with me, or has mercy on us, then who will protect the unbelievers from a painful chastisement?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: bethink ye if Allah destroy me and those with me; or have mercy on us, who will protect the infidels from a torment afflictive?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW): "Tell me! If Allah destroys me, and those with me, or He bestows His Mercy on us, - who can save the disbelievers from a painful torment?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “Have you considered? Should God make me perish, and those with me; or else He bestows His mercy on us; who will protect the disbelievers from an agonizing torment?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Say to them: “Did you ever consider: whether Allah destroys me and those that are with me, or shows mercy to us, who can protect the unbelievers from a grievous chastisement?”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "Tell me! If Allah destroys me, and those with me, or He bestows His mercy on us - who can save the disbelievers from a painful torment"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say (O Muhammad): Have ye thought: Whether Allah causeth me (Muhammad) and those with me to perish or hath mercy on us, still, who will protect the disbelievers from a painful doom?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘Tell me, whether Allah destroys me and those who are with me, or He has mercy on us, who will shelter the faithless from a painful punishment?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'What do you think, if Allah destroys me and those with me, or has mercy upon us, who then will protect the unbelievers from the painful punishment'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, [O Muhammad], "Have you considered: whether Allah should cause my death and those with me or have mercy upon us, who can protect the disbelievers from a painful punishment?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), say, "Have you not considered that regardless whether God forgives me and my followers or grants us mercy, but who will protect the disbelievers from a painful torment?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: Have you considered if Allah should destroy me and those with me-- rather He will have mercy on us; yet who will protect the unbelievers from a painful punishment?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul araaytum in ahlakaniya Allahu waman maAAiya aw rahimana faman yujeeru alkafireena min AAathabin aleemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Say, "Have you thought: if God destroys me and those who are with me, or treats us mercifully, then who will protect those who deny the truth from a painful chastisement?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say: "See ye?- If Allah were to destroy me, and those with me, or if He bestows His Mercy on us,- yet who can deliver the Unbelievers from a grievous Penalty?"

verses.text: قُلْ‌ هُوَ الرَّحْمٰنُ‌ آمَنَّا بِهِ‌ وَ عَلَيْهِ‌ تَوَکَّلْنَا فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ‌ مَنْ‌ هُوَ فِي‌ ضَلاَلٍ‌ مُبِينٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: اوست رحمان، به او ایمان آوردیم، و بر او توکل کردیم، پس به زودی خواهید دانست چه کسی در گمراهی آشکار است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: او خداى رحمان است. به او ايمان آورديم و بر او توكل كرديم. و زودا كه خواهيد دانست چه كسى در گمراهى آشكار است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: او [خداى‌] رحمان است به او ايمان آورديم و تنها بر او توكل كرديم. پس به زودى خواهيد دانست چه كسى در گمراهى آشكار است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «اوست خداى بخشايشگر، به او ايمان آورديم، و بر او توكل كرديم. و به زودى خواهيد دانست چه كسى است كه خود در گمراهى آشكارى است.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو: (آن که من شما را به سوی او می‌خوانم) او خدای مهربان است که ما به او ایمان آورده و بر او توکل کردیم و به زودی شما را معلوم شود کیست که آشکارا به ضلالت و گمراهی است؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگو: خدا مهربان است و بدو ایمان آورده‌ایم و بدو پشت بسته‌ایم، لذا خواهید دانست که چه کسی (از ما و شما) در گمراهی و سرگشتگی آشکاری است. [[«آمَنَّا بِهِ وَ عَلَیْهِ تَوَکَّلْنَا»: این بخش اشاره ضمنی دارد به این که: ما به خدا ایمان آورده‌ایم، ولی شما بدو ایمان نیاورده‌اید، و ما بدو پشت بسته‌ایم، امّا شما به بتها و چیزهای دیگری پشت بسته‌اید و دلخوش هستید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو او خداوند رحمان است، که به او ایمان آورده‌ایم و بر او توکل کرده‌ایم، زودا بدانید که چه کسی در گمراهی آشکار است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «او خداوند رحمان است، ما به او ایمان آورده و بر او توکّل کرده‌ایم؛ و بزودی می‌دانید چه کسی در گمراهی آشکار است!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو او است خدای مهربان ایمان آوردیم بدو و بر او توکل کردیم زود است بدانید کیست آنکه او است در گمراهی آشکار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: او خداى رحمان است، به او ايمان آورديم و بر او توكل كرديم. پس بزودى خواهيد دانست چه كسى در گمراهى آشكار است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «او تنها رحمتگر بر آفریدگان است. به او ایمان آوردیم و تنها بر او توکل کردیم، پس به زودی خواهید دانست چه کسی است که خود در گمراهی آشکارگری است.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Say: "He is the benevolent; in Him do we believe, and in Him do we place our trust. You will now realise who is in manifest error."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Proclaim, “He only is the Most Gracious – we have accepted faith in Him and have relied only upon Him; so you will now realise who is in open error.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'He is the All-merciful. We believe in Him, and in Him we put all our trust. Assuredly, you will soon, know who is in manifest error.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: He is the Compassionate; in Him we have believed, and in Him we have put our trust. -And anon ye will know who it is that is in error manifest.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say: "He is the Most Beneficent (Allah), in Him we believe, and in Him we put our trust. So you will come to know who is it that is in manifest error."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “He is the Compassionate. We have faith in Him, and in Him we trust. Soon you will know who is in evident error.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Say to them: “He is Merciful, and it is in Him that we believe, and it is in Him that we put all our trust. Soon will you know who is in manifest error.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "He is the Most Gracious, in Him we believe, and upon Him we rely. So, you will come to know who it is that is in manifest error."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say: He is the Beneficent. In Him we believe and in Him we put our trust. And ye will soon know who it is that is in error manifest.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘He is the All-beneficent; we have faith in Him, and in Him do we trust. Soon you will know who is in manifest error.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'He is the Merciful. In Him we believe and in Him we put all our trust. Indeed, you shall soon know who is in clear error'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, "He is the Most Merciful; we have believed in Him, and upon Him we have relied. And you will [come to] know who it is that is in clear error."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Say, "He is the Beneficent One in whom we have faith and trust. You will soon know who is in manifest error".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: He is the Beneficent Allah, we believe in Him and on Him do we rely, so you shall come to know who it is that is in clear error.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul huwa alrrahmanu amanna bihi waAAalayhi tawakkalna fasataAAlamoona man huwa fee dalalin mubeenin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Say, "He is the Most Gracious: we believe in Him and we put our trust in Him. You will soon come to know who is in evident error."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say: "He is (Allah) Most Gracious: We have believed in Him, and on Him have we put our trust: So, soon will ye know which (of us) it is that is in manifest error."

verses.text: قُلْ‌ أَ رَأَيْتُمْ‌ إِنْ‌ أَصْبَحَ‌ مَاؤُکُمْ‌ غَوْراً فَمَنْ‌ يَأْتِيکُمْ‌ بِمَاءٍ مَعِينٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: به من خبر دهید اگر آب مورد بهره برداری شما [چون آب رودها، چشمه ها، سدها و چاه ها] در زمین فرو رود [تا آنجا که از دسترس شما خارج گردد] پس کیست که برایتان آب روان و گوارا بیاورد؟!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: اگر آبتان در زمين فرو رود، چه كسى شما را آب روان خواهد داد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: به من خبر دهيد، اگر آب شما [در زمين‌] فرو رود، چه كسى آب روان برايتان خواهد آورد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «به من خبر دهيد، اگر آب [آشاميدنى‌] شما [به زمين‌] فرو رود، چه كسى آب روان برايتان خواهد آورد؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو: چه تصوّر می‌کنید؟ اگر آب (که مایه زندگانی) شما (است) همه به زمین فرو رود (جز خدا) کیست که باز آب روان و گوارا برای شما پدید آرد؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگو: مرا خبر دهید، اگر آبهای (مورد استفاده‌ی) شما به زمین فرو رود، چه کسی می‌تواند آب روان در دسترس شما مردمان قرار دهد؟! [[«غَوْراً»: فرو رفتن در زمین. مصدر است و مراد اسم فاعل، یعنی غائر است و به معنی فرو رونده است (نگا: کهف / 41). «مَعِینٍ»: جاری، روان (نگا: مؤمنون / 50، صافّات / 45، واقعه / 18).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو ملاحظه کنید، اگر آب شما در زمین فرو رود [و ناپدید گردد] چه کسی برای شما آب روان می‌آورد؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «به من خبر دهید اگر آبهای (سرزمین) شما در زمین فرو رود، چه کسی می‌تواند آب جاری و گوارا در دسترس شما قرار دهد؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو آیا دیدید اگر بامداد کند آب شما فرو رفته کیست که آورد شما را به آبی نمایان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: مرا گوييد كه اگر آب شما [به زمين‌] فرو شود، چه كسى شما را آب روان مى‌آورد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «آیا دیدید اگر آبِ شما، فروکشد، پس چه کس برایتان آبی جاری خواهد آورد؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Say: "Just think: If your water were to dry up in the morning who will bring you water from a fresh, flowing stream?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Say, “What is your opinion – if in the morning all your water were to sink into the earth, then who is such who can bring you water flowing before you?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'What think you? If in the morning your water should have vanished into the earth, then who would bring you running water?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: bethink ye, were your water to be sunk away, who then could bring you water welling-up?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW): "Tell me! If (all) your water were to be sunk away, who then can supply you with flowing (spring) water?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “Have you considered? If your water drains away, who will bring you pure running water?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Say to them: “Did you even consider: if all the water that you have (in the wells) were to sink down into the depths of the earth, who will produce for you clear, flowing water?”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "Tell me! If (all) your water were to sink away, who then can supply you with flowing water"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say: Have ye thought: If (all) your water were to disappear into the earth, who then could bring you gushing water?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘Tell me, should your water sink down [into the ground], who will bring you running water?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'What do you think. If your water should sink into the earth in the morning, who then would bring you running water'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, "Have you considered: if your water was to become sunken [into the earth], then who could bring you flowing water?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Say, "Have you not thought that if your water was to dry up, who would bring you water from the spring?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: Have you considered if your water should go down, who is it then that will bring you flowing water?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul araaytum in asbaha maokum ghawran faman yateekum bimain maAAeenin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Say, "Have you considered if your water were to sink  into the ground, who could then bring you flowing water?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say: "See ye?- If your stream be some morning lost (in the underground earth), who then can supply you with clear-flowing water?"
